    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Shaitan</h1>Hailing from the Plane of Earth, shaitans are proud and brazen genies. They value physical skill and love bargaining, games of chance, and working with metal and stone. Immense gemstones and veins of precious metal crisscross their home plane, and the industrious shaitans have built a vast mercantile empire from these abundant natural resources.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Elemental</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2">Arcana</a></u>, <u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 25<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=213">Shaitan</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 7</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Genie_Shaitan.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Genie_Shaitan.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Lawful Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Neutral">LN</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Earth Trait" class="trait" title="Effects with the earth trait either manipulate or conjure earth. Those that manipulate earth have no effect in an area without earth. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of earth or have a magical connection to that element."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=55">Earth</a></span><span alt="Elemental Trait" class="trait" title="Elementals are creatures directly tied to an element and native to the Elemental Planes. Elementals don’t need to breathe."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=57">Elemental</a></span><span alt="Genie Trait" class="trait" title="The diverse families of genies hold positions of prominence on the Elemental Planes. They have powerful magical abilities."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=216">Genie</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 164</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +15; darkvision, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a>, tremorsense (imprecise) 60 feet<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=22"><u>Terran</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +19, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +14, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +16, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10"><u>Nature</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14"><u>Society</a></u> +14<br /><b>Str</b> +6, <b>Dex</b> +1, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> +3, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +3<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=18"><u><i>+1 falchion</i></u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 25, <b>Fort</b> +18, <b>Ref</b> +12, <b>Will</b> +15<br /><b>HP</b> 110; <b>Resistances</b> electricity 10<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet, burrow 45 feet, climb 20 feet; earth glide<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>falchion</i> +20 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=180"><u>forceful +1</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=194"><u>sweep</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d10+12 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +19 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188"><u>nonlethal</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d4+12 bludgeoning plus Push 10 feet and shove into stone</span><b>Arcane Innate Spells</b> DC 24; <b>7th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=222">plane shift</a></u></i> (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only); <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=355">veil</a></u></i> (self only), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=365">wall of stone</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=276">shape stone</a></u></i> (at will); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=136">glitterdust</a></u></i> (x2); <b>Constant</b> <b>(4th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Earth Glide</b> The shaitan can Burrow through dirt and stone at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Shove into Stone</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=55"><u>earth</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) When the shaitan Pushes a creature into a stone barrier, the target must succeed at a DC 22 Reflex save or become merged with the barrier (as <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=188"><i>meld with stone</i></a>). The victim can attempt to Escape (DC 28).</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Shaitan Pashas</h3>Shaitan pashas fulfill wishes as efficiently as possible. A wish granted might create a temporary reality—a wish for a pet dragon might find the dragon lasts only a day before it vanishes or dies. Shaitan pashas add the following to their innate spells: <b>8th</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=95"><i>earthquake</i></a>; <b>6th</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=123"><i>flesh to stone</i></a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=312"><i>stoneskin</i> (at will; self only)</a>.<h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=50">Genie</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=212">Djinni</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=214">Efreeti</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=211">Janni</a></td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=215">Marid</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=213">Shaitan</a></td><td>7</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=50">Genie</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 162</i></a><br />A unique type of genie exists for each Elemental Plane, and the bodies of genies are formed out of elemental matter corresponding to their native plane: djinn are formed from wind, clouds, and storms; efreet are fire made flesh; marids are beings of water; and shaitans are composed of metal, gems, and stone. Lastly, the jann are formed out of all four elements, and are the weakest of geniekind. <h2 class="title">Genie Nobles</h2> Genie nobles with titles unique to their kind (as detailed in each sidebar) rule genie society. Genie nobles are generally at least 5 levels higher than a typical example of their kind. In addition to the increased statistics afforded by their higher levels, genie nobles gain additional spells. But the most wondrous (and notorious) of a genie noble’s powers is their ability to grant wishes. Any genie noble (save for jann, who lack this power) can grant a mortal or undead creature up to three wishes within a year’s time. Many unscrupulous creatures compel genie nobles to serve them, tricking them or entrapping them with magic. However, once a genie noble grants a third wish to a single creature, they are freed from service to that creature forever.</span>

                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
